title: Manchester United will NOT sign Ivan Rakitic as Barcelona star's family rule out move to England
text:
Manchester United have been dealt a huge blow over their pursuit of Ivan Rakitic, with his family ruling out a move.

United had been put on hot alert over Rakitic's situation at Barcelona - having made six of his seven appearances from the bench this campaign despite being a regular under Ernesto Valverde last season.

The Barcelona manager has opted to start summer signing Frenkie de Jong ahead of him, while he also finds himself behind Sergio Busquets and Arthur Melo in the midfield pecking order.

Croatian midfielder Ivan Rakitic has seen his playing time limited for Barcelona this season

But United's pursuit of the Croatian has hit a wall, with his family not keen on moving to Manchester.

The 31-year-old star is hopeful of staying at the Nou Camp but if his situation doesn't change and he is forced out, Rakitic and his family would prefer a move to Paris, Milan or a location with warmer climes than Manchester.

United enquired about Rakitic in December and January and the clubs maintained dialogue but that tailed off in March.

Manchester United are interested in signing Newcastle midfielder Sean Longstaff

Barcelona are desperate to sell a few players to free up some money so sounded out United again but Rakitic's family have made it clear they don't want to move to Manchester.

Newcastle's Sean Longstaff, Leicester midfielder James Maddison and Juventus' Emre Can are now among the options for United.

However, the Red Devils are expecting it to be difficult to acquire key signings in the January transfer window.
